solution_line_template: Phoebe is having {num_guests} guests and Monica charges ${cost_per_person} per person so that’s {num_guests}*{cost_per_person} = $<<{num_guests}*{cost_per_person}={base_cost}>>{base_cost}

Phoebe is a repeat customer so she gets {discount_percent_num}% off of ${base_cost} so that’s {discount_percent_decimal}*{base_cost} = $<<{discount_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{base_cost}={discount_amount}>>{discount_amount} discount
Monica is charging ${base_cost} minus the repeat customer discount of ${discount_amount} so she will make {base_cost}-{discount_amount} = $<<{base_cost}-{discount_amount}={final_cost}>>{final_cost}
